intro: Trichera albanica, commonly known as the Albanian trichera, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested areas, showing a preference for well-drained soils. It is known for its ability to fix atmospheric nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
